name: Structure Bridge
description: TRIZ Structure Bridge - Analyzes system structure and relationships

principles.name: Segmentation
principles.description: Divide an object into independent parts; make an object easy to assemble/disassemble; increase the degree of segmentation

principles.name: Taking out
principles.description: Separate an interfering part or property from an object; single out the only necessary part or property

principles.name: Local quality
principles.description: Change an object's structure from uniform to non-uniform; change external environment from uniform to non-uniform; make each part function in conditions most suitable for its operation

principles.name: Asymmetry
principles.description: Change shape or properties from symmetrical to asymmetrical; if object is asymmetrical, increase degree of asymmetry

principles.name: Merging
principles.description: Bring identical or similar objects together; assemble objects carrying out similar operations; make operations occur simultaneously

principles.name: Universality
principles.description: Make an object perform multiple functions; eliminate need for other components

principles.name: Nested doll
principles.description: Place one object inside another; place each object inside the other; make one part pass through cavity of the other

principles.name: Anti-weight
principles.description: Compensate weight with lifting force; compensate weight by interaction with environment

principles.name: Preliminary anti-action
principles.description: Perform required changes before harmful effect occurs; pre-arrange objects for timely action

principles.name: Preliminary action
principles.description: Perform required changes before it is needed; pre-position objects for timely action

principles.name: Beforehand cushioning
principles.description: Prepare emergency means beforehand to compensate for low reliability

principles.name: Equipotentiality
principles.description: Change working conditions to eliminate need to raise/lower objects

principles.name: The other way round
principles.description: Instead of action dictated by problem, implement opposite action; make moving parts fixed and fixed parts moving; turn object upside down

principles.name: Spheroidality
principles.description: Replace linear parts with curved parts; use rollers, balls, spirals; go from cubic to spherical structures

principles.name: Dynamics
principles.description: Characteristics of object should change automatically to optimize performance; divide object into elements capable of changing relative positions

principles.name: Partial or excessive actions
principles.description: If difficult to achieve 100% effect, achieve more or less; simplify problem by slightly exceeding or falling short of required effect

principles.name: Moving to a new dimension
principles.description: Remove problems by moving to 2D or 3D space; use multi-story arrangement; tilt or re-orient object

principles.name: Mechanical vibration
principles.description: Cause object to oscillate or vibrate; increase frequency; use resonance frequency; replace mechanical with piezoelectric vibration

principles.name: Periodic action
principles.description: Replace continuous action with periodic; if already periodic, change frequency or amplitude

principles.name: Continuity of useful action
principles.description: Carry on work continuously; eliminate idle and intermittent actions; replace reciprocating motion with rotary

principles.name: Skipping
principles.description: Conduct process at high speed to eliminate harmful effects; skip over problematic stages

principles.name: Blessing in disguise
principles.description: Use harmful factors to achieve positive effect; eliminate harmful factor by combining with another harmful factor

principles.name: Feedback
principles.description: Introduce feedback to improve process; if feedback exists, change its magnitude or influence

principles.name: Intermediary
principles.description: Use intermediary carrier to transfer action; temporarily connect objects together

principles.name: Self-service
principles.description: Make object serve itself; use waste resources or energy

principles.name: Copying
principles.description: Replace expensive object with cheap copies; use optical copies with scale changes; use infrared or ultraviolet copies

principles.name: Cheap short-living objects
principles.description: Replace expensive durable object with multiple inexpensive short-living objects; sacrifice one-time objects

principles.name: Mechanics substitution
principles.description: Replace mechanical means with visual, acoustic, thermal, olfactory; use electric, magnetic, electromagnetic fields

principles.name: Pneumatics and hydraulics
principles.description: Replace solid parts with gas or liquid; use air cushions, hydraulic construction, hydrostatic/hydrodynamic systems

principles.name: Flexible shells and thin films
principles.description: Replace 3D constructions with 2D films; use inflatable structures; isolate objects with thin films

principles.name: Porous materials
principles.description: Make object porous or add porous elements; fill pores with substance; use capillary action

principles.name: Color changes
principles.description: Change color of object or environment; use color additives; use luminescent materials

principles.name: Homogeneity
principles.description: Make interacting objects of same material; make objects compatible with environment

principles.name: Discarding and recovering
principles.description: Make parts that fulfill their function disappear after use; restore consumed parts during operation

principles.name: Parameter changes
principles.description: Change object's physical state; change concentration or consistency; change flexibility; change temperature

principles.name: Phase transitions
principles.description: Use phenomena during phase transitions; use thermal expansion/contraction; use evaporation/condensation

principles.name: Thermal expansion
principles.description: Use thermal expansion or contraction; combine materials with different coefficients of thermal expansion

principles.name: Strong oxidants
principles.description: Replace common air with enriched air; replace enriched air with pure oxygen; use ionized or ozone-enriched air

principles.name: Inert atmosphere
principles.description: Replace normal environment with inert one; add neutral elements or inert additives

principles.name: Composite materials
principles.description: Replace homogeneous materials with composite ones; use layered structures; use gradient materials

application_guidelines: Use structure bridge when dealing with physical arrangement, component relationships, or system architecture problems. Focus on how components are organized and interact with each other.
